free_text.Prérequis: Geology I & II (Geologie I & II), Soil Mechanics (Mécanique des sols et écoulements souterrains)
free_text.Contenu: [li]Mechanics applicable to rock and discontinuities, strength and failure criteria[br/][li]Geological process and formation of rock mass, inhomogeneity, in situ stresses and groundwater[br/][li]Properties of rock material and discontinuities, failure and strength criteria, laboratory tests and field characterisations[br/][li]Rock mass properties and classifications, rock mass strength and deformation, strength criteria[br/][li]Rock foundations analysis and design: construction, bearing capacity, settlements[br/][li]Rock slopes stability analysis and support methods[br/][li]Geological factors affect tunnelling, methods of geological investigation, ground condition and geo-material properties[br/][li]Stress and displacement of ground with tunnelling, ground-support interaction[br/][li]Methods of tunnel excavation, tunnel boring machines, ground improvements and temporally support, observational method in tunnelling[br/][li]Failure mechanisms of tunnels, methods of tunnel support design, empirical tunnel support design[br/][li]Ground load calculation and segmental concrete lining design for soft ground tunnels[br/][li]Numerical methods for rock mechanics and tunnelling, continuum and discontinuum modelling, modelling of excavation, support and stability[br/][li]Ground losses and displacement, estimation of tunnel settlement[br/][li]Instrumentation and monitoring in tunnelling, back analysis technique
free_text.Forme du contrôle: Written[br/]Note: an intermediate examination will be programmed at the end of the first part of the course (Rock Mechanics)
free_text.Préparation pour: Underground Construction Technology, Soil structure interaction (Interaction sol-structure)
free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: Rock Mechanics: [br/][li]To understand of the mechanical behaviour of rock materials and masses, and be able to analyse mechanical properties of rocks for civil engineering applications;[br/][br/]Tunnel Engineering:[br/][li]To be able to use appropriate methods for carrying out analysis and design of tunnel excavation and support by understanding the mechanisms of rock ground masses - support interaction.
